item.title: The Archipelago Effect: Connecting Microservice Islands with a Hexagonal Core
item.description:
TL;DR

“Avoid excessive microservice fragmentation by grouping affiliated domain services and workers into individual deployable units.”

Ever since Microservices became a “thing”, the industry has spent it’s time fragmenting monolithic applications into seemingly ever smaller and smaller pieces. The promise of independent deployability and scalability has been a siren call to many organisations, but the reality has been a little more sobering - the more services you have, the more complex both the interactions between them become, the more difficult to sensibly integrate and observe the codebase becomes, and the more difficult it becomes to maintain a coherent architecture.
